intro: Tanacetum mucroniferum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tansy, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. It is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in well-drained soils. Tanacetum mucroniferum is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
